system.description:
Your ancient magic takes you to places where few seek to tread. Your wilderness training lets you walk there unafraid. You gain the following benefits:

  • Half your ranger levels count as witch levels for the purpose of the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.f3gqgjl29sdwvt7i]{A Blessing or a Curse} feature and gain an additional benefit based on the option you choose:
    • If you choose @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.8icd91l5z34orf66]{Witch's Blessing}, you can spend a use when making a weapon attack. If you do, the bonus damage done by your @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.yuncbhlz6js1w4t4]{Hunter's Target} feature increases to 1d12, is radiant damage and on a successful hit outlines the target in a faerie fire effect until the end of its next turn.
    • If you choose @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.5xuo47w64m4cow6c]{Witch's Curse}, you can spend a use when making a weapon attack. If you do, the bonus damage done by your Hunter’s Target feature increases to 1d12, is necrotic damage and the target cannot recover hit points until the end of its next turn.
  • You can rely upon your magic to help you track targets. If you fail on a Survival check while tracking, you can spend a first-level or higher spell slot to immediately roll a d8 and add it to the results of the check, potentially turning a failure into a success.
  • When you perform a journey activity from the following list, pick a second as well: Gather Components, Harvest, Hunt and Gather. You perform both activities simultaneously, but roll for them separately, even if they use the same skill.
  • When you would select an @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.oob7093n1ddzwm8f]{Exploration Knack} or @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.vmkfr5u0neendp2v]{Magical Mystery}, you may choose from either list, but must meet any prerequisites.
system.prerequisite: Walker of the Ancient Paths feat
